   20: -module(logger_simple_h_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/logger.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_internal.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -import(logger_test_lib, [setup/2, log/3, sync_and_read/3]).
   30: 
   31: -define(check_no_log,[] = test_server:messages_get()).
   32: -define(check(Expected),
   33:         receive {log,Expected} ->
   34:                 [] = test_server:messages_get()
   35:         after 1000 ->
   36:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   37:                          {line,?LINE},
   38:                          {expected,Expected},
   39:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   40:         end).
   41: 
   42: -define(str,"Log from "++atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++
   43:             ":"++integer_to_list(?LINE)).
   44: -define(map_rep,#{function=>?FUNCTION_NAME, line=>?LINE}).
   45: -define(keyval_rep,[{function,?FUNCTION_NAME}, {line,?LINE}]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   49: 
   50: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   51:     Hs0 = logger:get_handler_config(),
   52:     Hs = lists:keydelete(cth_log_redirect,1,Hs0),
   53:     [ok = logger:remove_handler(Id) || {Id,_,_} <- Hs],
   54:     Env = [{App,Key,application:get_env(App,Key)} ||
   55:               {App,Key} <- [{kernel,logger_level}]],
   56:     [{env,Env},{logger,Hs}|Config].
   57: 
   58: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   59:     [application:set_env(App,Key,Val) || {App,Key,Val} <- ?config(env,Config)],
   60:     Hs = ?config(logger,Config),
   61:     [ok = logger:add_handler(Id,Mod,C) || {Id,Mod,C} <- Hs],
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(_Group, _Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   74:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
   75:     catch error:undef -> ok
   76:     end,
   77:     ok.
   78: 
   79: groups() ->
   80:     [].
   81: 
   82: all() -> 
   83:     [start_stop,
   84:      start_debug,
   85:      start_crash,
   86:      replace_default,
   87:      replace_file,
   88:      replace_disk_log
   89:     ].
   90: 
   91: start_stop(_Config) ->
   92:     undefined = whereis(logger_simple_h),
   93:     register(logger_simple_h,self()),
   94:     {error,_} = logger:add_handler(simple,
   95:                                    logger_simple_h,
   96:                                    #{filter_default=>log}),    
   97:     unregister(logger_simple_h),
   98:     ok = logger:add_handler(simple,logger_simple_h,#{filter_default=>log}),
   99:     Pid = whereis(logger_simple_h),
  100:     true = is_pid(Pid),
  101:     ok = logger:remove_handler(simple),
  102:     false = is_pid(whereis(logger_simple_h)),
  103:     ok.
  104: start_stop(cleanup,_Config) ->
  105:     logger:remove_handler(simple).
  106: 
  107: %% Test that the simple logger works when debug level is used
  108: start_debug(_Config) ->
  109: 
  110:     Output = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -s init stop"),
  111:     LogOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(Output),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  112:     ct:log("~ts",[LogOutput]),
  113:     nomatch = re:run(LogOutput,"^=PROGRESS REPORT====",[global,multiline]),
  114: 
  115:     InfoOutput = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -kernel logger_level info -s init stop"),
  116:     InfoLogOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(InfoOutput),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  117:     ct:log("~ts",[InfoLogOutput]),
  118:     {match,InfoNumReports} = re:run(InfoLogOutput,"^=PROGRESS REPORT====",[global,multiline]),
  119: 
  120:     %% Test that more progress reports are logged for info than default
  121:     ?assert(0 < length(InfoNumReports)),
  122: 
  123:     DebugOutput = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -kernel logger_level debug -s init stop"),
  124:     DebugLogOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(DebugOutput),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  125:     ct:log("~ts",[DebugLogOutput]),
  126:     {match,DebugNumReports} = re:run(DebugLogOutput,"^=PROGRESS REPORT====",[global,multiline]),
  127: 
  128:     %% Test that more progress reports are logged for debug than info
  129:     ?assert(length(InfoNumReports) < length(DebugNumReports)),
  130: 
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: %% Test that the simple logger works during startup crash
  134: start_crash(_Config) ->
  135: 
  136:     Output = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -user baduser"),
  137:     ErrorOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(Output),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  138:     ct:log("~ts",[ErrorOutput]),
  139:     {match,[_]} = re:run(ErrorOutput,"(^=SUPERVISOR REPORT====| supervisor_report *\n)",[global,multiline]),
  140:     {match,[_, _]} = re:run(ErrorOutput," crash_report *\n",[global]),
  141:     {match,[_]} = re:run(ErrorOutput," std_info *\n",[global]),
  142:     {match,[[CD]]} = re:run(ErrorOutput,"\nCrash dump is being written to: (.*)\\.\\.\\.done",
  143:                             [{capture, all_but_first, binary}, global]),
  144:     ok = file:delete(CD),
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: 
  148: %% This testcase just tests that it does not crash, the default handler prints
  149: %% to stdout which we cannot read from in a detached slave.
  150: replace_default(Config) ->
  151: 
  152:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  153:     log(Node, emergency, [?str]),
  154:     log(Node, alert, [?str,[]]),
  155:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  156:     log(Node, info, [?keyval_rep]),
  157:     log(Node, info, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  158:     rpc:call(Node, error_logger, error_report, [some_type,?map_rep]),
  159:     rpc:call(Node, error_logger, warning_report, ["some_type",?map_rep]),
  160:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  161:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  162: 
  163:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers, [kernel]),
  164: 
  165:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
  166: 
  167: replace_file(Config) ->
  168: 
  169:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  170:     log(Node, emergency, [M1=?str]),
  171:     log(Node, alert, [M2=?str,[]]),
  172:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  173:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep]),
  174:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  175:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  176:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  177: 
  178:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  179:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".log"),
  180: 
  181:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers,
  182:                   [[{handler, default, logger_std_h,
  183:                      #{ config => #{ type => {file, File} },
  184:                         formatter => {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}}}]]),
  185: 
  186:     {ok,Bin} = sync_and_read(Node, file, File),
  187:     Lines = [unicode:characters_to_list(L) ||
  188:                 L <- binary:split(Bin,<<"\n">>,[global,trim])],
  189:     ["=EMERGENCY REPORT===="++_,
  190:      M1,
  191:      "=ALERT REPORT===="++_,
  192:      M2,
  193:      "=ERROR REPORT===="++_,
  194:      _,
  195:      _,
  196:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  197:      _,
  198:      _,
  199:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  200:      _,
  201:      _,
  202:      _,
  203:      "=CRITICAL REPORT===="++_,
  204:      _,
  205:      _,
  206:      "=NOTICE REPORT===="++_,
  207:      _
  208:     ] = Lines,
  209:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
  210: 
  211: replace_disk_log(Config) ->
  212: 
  213:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  214:     log(Node, emergency, [M1=?str]),
  215:     log(Node, alert, [M2=?str,[]]),
  216:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  217:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep]),
  218:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  219:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  220:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  221: 
  222:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  223:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".log"),
  224: 
  225:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers,
  226:                   [[{handler, default, logger_disk_log_h,
  227:                      #{ config => #{ file => File },
  228:                         formatter => {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}}}]]),
  229:     {ok,Bin} = sync_and_read(Node, disk_log, File),
  230:     Lines = [unicode:characters_to_list(L) ||
  231:                 L <- binary:split(Bin,<<"\n">>,[global,trim])],
  232:     ["=EMERGENCY REPORT===="++_,
  233:      M1,
  234:      "=ALERT REPORT===="++_,
  235:      M2,
  236:      "=ERROR REPORT===="++_,
  237:      _,
  238:      _,
  239:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  240:      _,
  241:      _,
  242:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  243:      _,
  244:      _,
  245:      _,
  246:      "=CRITICAL REPORT===="++_,
  247:      _,
  248:      _,
  249:      "=NOTICE REPORT===="++_,
  250:      _
  251:     ] = Lines,
  252:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
